content: Singaporean footballer **Rezza Rezky Ramadhani bin Yacobjan** (born 8 November 2000) also known as **Rezza Rezky**, is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays for [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) club [Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC) on loan from [Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC). Rezza was 1st nominated for the 2017 [Dollah Salleh](/wiki/Dollah_Salleh) award but failed to win it. In 2018, he was nominated again for the award but this time round lost to [Nur Adam Abdullah](/wiki/Nur_Adam_Abdullah). ## Club career ### Young Lions In January 2019, Rezza was promoted from the [National Football Academy](/wiki/National_Football_Academy_(Singapore)) and signed with [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) club [Young Lions](/wiki/Young_Lions_FC). He make his professional debut on 31 March 2019 coming on as a substitution in a 3–1 win over [Hougang United](/wiki/Hougang_United_FC). On 26 June, Rezza would then scored his first professional goal against [Geylang International](/wiki/Geylang_International_FC) in a 2–1 win where he scored a header in the 1st minute of the match. ### Tampines Rovers On 11 October 2022, Rezza joined [Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC). He make his debut for the club coming on as a substitution against [Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC) on 20 October. #### Loan to Tanjong Pagar United On 23 February 2024, Rezza was loaned to Tanjong Pagar United. ## International career Rezza was invited for the [national team](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team) training on 3 and 10 March 2020. This was his first involvement with the senior side. ## Personal life Rezza brother, [Haiqal Pashia](/wiki/Haiqal_Pashia) is also a professional footballer currently playing in the Singapore Premier League for [Lion City Sailors](/wiki/Lion_City_Sailors_FC). Both were called up for the [2019 Merlion Cup](/wiki/2019_Merlion_Cup). ## Career statistics ### Club *As of 25 May 2025*ClubSeasonLeagueCupContinentalOtherTotalDivisionAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoals[Young Lions](/wiki/Young_Lions_FC)(/wiki/2019_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)101000000101(/wiki/2020_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)2000000020(/wiki/2021_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)9000000090(/wiki/2022_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)5000000050Total261000000261[Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers)(/wiki/2022_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)1030000040(/wiki/2023_Singapore_Premier_League)[Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League)100400000140Total110700000180[Tanjong Pagar United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United) (loan)[2024–25](/wiki/2024%E2%80%9325_Singapore_Premier_League)Singapore Premier League251300000281Total251300000281Career total6221000000722 ## Honours ### International **Singapore U22** - [Merlion Cup](/wiki/Merlion_Cup): (/wiki/2019_Merlion_Cup) This biographical article related to Singaporean association football is a stub. title: Rezza Rezky
